result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, James V Hudson was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Douglas Henderson.   Testimony of State witnesses heard:  KPD Officers George Larsen, Jeff Galley, and Terrance Grabot; Jeremiah D.; KPD Det. Peter Dentes.  State rests at 10:28.   Defense will call no witnesses and rests at 10:30.  Jury released at 10:35 and to return at 1:00.
1:00 - Jury instructions and closing arguments.   Alternate juror excused.  Deliberations began at 2:00; verdict reached at 2:07.  Verdict of guilty to both counts.  The State stipulates to a finding of not guilty by reason or mental disease or defect; judgment entered by the Court.  Def. is committed to DHS for 15 years commencing today, credit for 748 days served in Co. Jail.  Firearm warning and body armor warning given.  DHS to conduct a predisposition investigation; report to be filed with the court by 12/21/16.  Disposition hearing 1/20/17 at 9:00.
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Doug Henderson.  Clerk T. Lehman.  Voir dire commences @ 9:16am.  Jury selected @ 10:18am.  Unselected jurors released for the day @ 10:19am.  Jury sworn.  Jurors excused from courtroom.  Miranda Goodchild commences.  Testimony taken from Det. Jason Melichar.  State's exhibit #1 & #2 offered/received.  No further evidence presented by either side.  Court finds the deft's statement was given voluntarily and is admissible in the State's case.  Jurors reconvene @ 10:59am.  Preliminary instructions given to the jury.  Opening statements given.  Jurors excused @ 11:15am - instructed to return @ 1pm.
1:00 pm - Clerk K. Zirbel.  Testimony of State witnesses Sophia T., Aimee D., KPD Sgt. Trevor Albrecht, Nicole K., Justin N., Michael M., and Leah R. heard.  Court adjourns for the day at 4:04 p.m.; to reconvene on 12/6/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.
